formalpara.title: BAROQUE
formalpara.para: Defined by ornate and extravagant arrangements and melodies, Baroque style held sway in Europe from about 1600 to 1750. First applied in this context during the nineteenth century, the term comes from portugese Barroco....

formalpara.title: CLASSICISM
formalpara.para: A reaction against Baroque exuberance, the Classical era (1750-1820) was about balance, reason and finish ...

formalpara.title: ROMANTICISM
formalpara.para: Summed up by the poet Goethe in his phrase 'feeling is everything', the romatic movement dominated the nineteenth century ...
